member.summary: Gets identifier for the dependency.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependencyInstaller
member.summary: Interface for installing dependencies.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependencyInstaller.GetDependency(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object of type IDependency for a given dependencyId string.
member.param: A valid product identifier from Web Platform Installer feed.
member.exception: Thrown when dependencyId is not a valid Web Platform Installer product identifier.
Thrown when Web Platform Installer feed is not accessible.
member.returns: An object of type IDependency for the given dependencyId string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependencyInstaller.EnsureDependencies(Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependency,Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependency[])
member.summary:
Ensures that the specifed dependencies are installed on the machine. If not installed, it starts a new wizard to install them. Throws when dependencies of invalid types are passed. Only the return value of IDependencyInstaller::GetDependency or known dependencies are allowed. This method will throw for any other IDependency types.
e.g. dependencyInstaller.EnsureDependency(dependencyInstaller.GetDependency("my-product-id"))
member.param: Optional additional dependencies to be installed.
member.exception: Throws when dependencies of invalid types are passed. Only the return value of IDependencyInstaller::GetDependency is allowed. This method will throw for any other IDependency types.
member.returns: true on success, false on install failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependencyInstaller.EnsureDependencies(System.String,Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependency,Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.IDependency[])
member.summary:
Ensures that the specifed product dependencies are installed on the machine. If not installed, it starts a new wizard to install them. Throws when dependencies of invalid types are passed. Only the return value of IDependencyInstaller::GetDependency is allowed. This method will throw for any other IDependency types.
e.g. dependencyInstaller.EnsureDependency("Installing following product(s)", dependencyInstaller.GetDependency("my-product-id"))
member.param: Message to be displayed on the install wizard.
Optional additional dependencies to be installed.
member.exception: Throws when dependencies of invalid types are passed. Only the return value of IDependencyInstaller::GetDependency or known dependencies are allowed. This method will throw for any other IDependency types.
member.returns: true on success, false on install failure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.INewSiteProviderAsync
member.summary: A provider that will add new site creation options to WebMatrix.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.INewSiteProviderAsync.CreateSiteAsync(System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Entry point called by WebMatrix to initiate creating the site,
member.param: Default root folder where the site should be created under. e.g. My Documents\My Web Sites
member.returns: a task that upon completion provides a DirectoryInfo object indicating where the site was actually created. If the task is null, the directory info is null, or the directory does not exist, WebMatrix will ignore the result.
member.remarks:
The implementer should create a folder, populate it with files, and if desired setup databases etc.
The implementer is responsible for any UI and error messaging along the process. WebMatrix will then create the site by calling site from folder command. When the site is created and opened, the website changed event will fire, the implementer can then use it for any followup fixup code to execute post site creation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.INewSiteProviderAsync.Icon
member.summary: Icon to be shown next to the text.
member.remarks: Icon must be present, otherwise the menu will not be shown.

member.summary: Gets an invariant name for the menu item to be created.
member.remarks: This name can be used by automation tools to identify the item created by this provided. This value should not be localized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.INewSiteProviderAsync.Label
member.summary: Label.
member.remarks: Limit length of text, it will be trimmed if too long.

member.summary: Optional tooltip.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the ribbon button for this package manager should be shown for the current site.
member.remarks: This value determines when the package manager button is shown in the ribbon. This method may be called whenever the ribbon is populated (when changing sites, or workspaces). This method will always be called on the UI thread.
member.example: For a site that uses Node.js, a package manager implementation can inspect the siteTechnologies parameter to determine if the current site uses Node.Js.

member.summary: Creates a modal dialog object with the specified title/message along with a wait indicator The dialog will show up after a prescribed delay on a call to Show(). The dialog will be closed either by clicking the cancel button and returning true from the callback Or by calling Hide (reusable call) or by disposing the dialog
member.param: Message to be shown in the dialog.
delay before dialog is shown, 2 seconds by default, zero or negative for no delay, and 10 seconds max time
Callback called when cancel button is pressed. Return true for cancel success, false and message for cancel failure
member.returns: an IWaitDialog object (IDisposable)
member.remarks: Pass null for the onCancel method if cancellation is not possible

member.summary: Helper to get relative/full paths in site.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.SourceControl.SitePathsHelper.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The full path to the root of a site.
member.remarks: This class is designed to work for disk paths on the same disk, e.g. if a path is mapped or is starts with \\ this class is not guaranteed to work.
member.exception: If path is empty, contains invalid chars or not fully rooted. e.g. c:\temp and \\machine\temp is fully rooted. \temp is not fully rooted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.SourceControl.SitePathsHelper.GetRelativePath(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a relative path from a full path.
member.returns: Relative path to BasePath, or the path if not rooted.
member.exception: If path is empty, contains invalid chars or not rooted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.SourceControl.SitePathsHelper.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Get absolute path from base path.
member.returns: Absolute path.
member.remarks:
This method behaves like Path.Combine such that if the passed in path is not relative it will just return it as is. However if the relative path is null or white space, the method will throw.
Common exceptions listed below, but any exception thrown by Path.GetFullPath can be thrown as well.
member.exception: When path is null, whitespace or contains invalid chars, non valid UNC path, or simple \ rooted file.
When path contains : which is not part of a volume i.e. c:

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.SourceControl.SourceControlDialogs.ShowSyncDialog(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Default implementation for synchronizing from a server to local
member.remarks:
Note default implementation of this is *slow and safe* -- one call per file to provider. Ideally, most of the source control system prefer batch action due to bandwidth/server load issue However, If source control provider prefer batch action for the performance reason, then is likely source control provider will have to implementation it's own way of cancelling long running process, progress report, exception handler, report the errors.
If performance is the concern, then source control provider should definitely override this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WebMatrix.SourceControl.SourceControlDialogs.RemoveFromSourceControl(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Remove a file from source code control. Shows UI.
member.remarks:
Note default implementation of this is *slow and safe* -- one call per file to provider. Ideally, most of the source control system prefer batch action due to bandwidth/server load issue However, If source control provider prefer batch action for the performance reason, then is likely source control provider will have to implementation it's own way of cancelling long running process, progress report, exception handler, report the errors.
If performance is the concern, then source control provider should definitely override this method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.Themes
member.summary: Public accessibility to common WebMatrix brushes. Use these brushes to match color themes to leverage WebMatrix's support for high contrast, classic and Aero themes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility.Themes.ClickableTextBrush
member.summary: ComponentResourceKey to be used for getting standard color and styles.
member.example:
Add the following namespace: xmlns:extensibility="clr-namespace:Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility;assembly=Microsoft.WebMatrix.Extensibility"
then you can you the key in a property using Dynamic Resource: Foreground="{DynamicResource {x:Static extensibility:Themes.ClickableTextBrush}}"
